result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:56 AM Defendant Todd A Beckius in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney McDougal appears by zoom. Court goes over the complaint and states that max penalties. Attorney Harper would move to amend the complaint to under the  influence of an intoxicate. Court states that it should be amended. Attorney McDougal asks for an adjourn initial appearance.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:00 PM Defendant Todd A Beckius appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Harper appears in person. Attorney McDougal appears by video.

State asks for $10,000 cash bond with the condition of defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

Attorney McDougal comments about the defendants background. Attorney McDougal asks for a signature bond or less then $1,000 cash bond.

Court orders a $10,000 signature bond with the condition of defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

Next date is May 17, 2022 at 10 AM

Counsel may appear by zoom per the court.
